lead_paragraph: Oakland defensive lineman Tyler Brayton was fined $25,000 and Seattle tight end Jerramy Stevens was fined $15,000 yesterday for an altercation at the end of their game Monday night. Brayton was ejected from the Raiders’ 16-0 loss for kneeing Stevens in the groin. Gene Washington, the N.F.L.’s director of football operations, ruled that Stevens attempted to kick Brayton in the groin area earlier on the same play, leading to his fine.
